intro: Hieracium schmidtii subsp. brachetianum, commonly known as the Schmidt's hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellowish to orange-yellow composite flowers and is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It has a rosette of basal leaves and is often found in high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
